
Intercepted RSA message 6014527663618134170759314384282546646715152433652693379158816652659903923906707999936385047073976935343535583266135410271690442272649898372115675360683518 was encrypted using a public key with a modulus that's a Blum integer. Can you exploit this vulnerability to recover the secret?


The flag format is flag{...}
n=7427368403136069588288722240282725623523365239330385714458414682767511129748969212839505413915877980011414708778600767122486604606915280810879362102723249, e=5868352100235147634819843373953390953055067324432012210335143160502121154595842716676419947127919033241947906065786738257511049737706378704643745819394941

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{9x724osy}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 6014527663618134170759314384282546646715152433652693379158816652659903923906707999936385047073976935343535583266135410271690442272649898372115675360683518
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=7427368403136069588288722240282725623523365239330385714458414682767511129748969212839505413915877980011414708778600767122486604606915280810879362102723249, e=5868352100235147634819843373953390953055067324432012210335143160502121154595842716676419947127919033241947906065786738257511049737706378704643745819394941
The lower 104 bits of p are: 63727585634947472303282978735247198683

extra_info: p=104749159584821008520043282232220836555893533062812675702154741086616744495579, q=70906233831133808041428153770170534006456811592396648500838952046010332645731, Ï†(n)=7427368403136069588288722240282725623523365239330385714458414682767511129748793557446089459099316508575412317408038416777831395282712287117746735025581940
